intro: Azalea liliiflora, commonly known as the Japanese azalea, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Rhododendron genus and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features dense, dark green foliage. Its flowers come in shades of pink, red, and white, often with a white throat, and are highly fragrant. Azalea liliiflora prefers acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
